name: walks on the beach towels
description:
Leisurely walks and talks with a new friend along a beach fringed by macaron-colored houses and a sparkling emerald sea.

These towels alternate plain weave stripes and twill stripes.

Colors: ivory, flax, salmon, yellow-orange, light green, turquoise green, light blue, cobalt

Approximately:  19” x 28”

100% cotton

These handwoven towels are absorbent, easy to care for, and develop a special beauty as you use them. 

Care instructions:  Wash them in your machine with warm or cold water and dry them on a medium heat to minimize shrinking and fading. Do not use fabric softener or dryer sheets as these can reduce the absorbency of the cloth.

name: I spy towels 2
description:
At the farmers' market I recognize some of the regulars by their shopping bags.  One of these bags is charcoal with multi-colored dots.

These towels alternate plain weave stripes and twill stripes.

Colors: charcoal, medium gray, kiwi, pumpkin, bermuda blue, cerise

Approximately:  19” x 29”

100% cotton

These handwoven towels are absorbent, easy to care for, and develop a special beauty as you use them. 

Care instructions:  Wash them in your machine with warm or cold water and dry them on a medium heat to minimize shrinking and fading. Do not use fabric softener or dryer sheets as these can reduce the absorbency of the cloth.

name: by the quarry towels
description:
I was running errands and thinking about color combinations when some purple wildflowers by the quarry caught my attention.  Then I started seeing purple flowers everywhere.

Colors: grass green, kiwi, magenta, lilac, red violet, dark green

100% cotton

Care instructions:  Wash them in your machine with warm or cold water and dry them on a medium heat to minimize shrinking and fading. Do not use fabric softener or dryer sheets as these can reduce the absorbency of the cloth.

name: Deb's red-letter day towels
description:
My friend Deb chose these colors based on a 1960 linen calendar towel with a folk art design in primary red, yellow, blue & green.  On the calendar her birthday, a Sunday, has a red numeral

Colors: scarlet, cerise, yellow, blue, green, chamois

Approximately:  18” x 26”

100% cotton

These handwoven towels are absorbent, easy to care for, and develop a special beauty as you use them. 

Care instructions:  Wash them in your machine with warm or cold water and dry them on a medium heat to minimize shrinking and fading. Do not use fabric softener or dryer sheets as these can reduce the absorbency of the cloth.

name: 101 north towels 1
description:
Shortly after meeting with a customer to decide colors for a special order, I drove north on Highway 101 and saw similar colors in the landscape -- dry hills dotted with trees.

Colors: dark green, white, honey, sierra

Approximately:  18” x 27”

100% cotton

These handwoven towels are absorbent, easy to care for, and develop a special beauty as you use them. 

Care instructions:  Wash them in your machine with warm or cold water and dry them on a medium heat to minimize shrinking and fading. Do not use fabric softener or dryer sheets as these can reduce the absorbency of the cloth.

name: riddle towels
description:
I'm not sure what it is that makes black, white and red such a compelling combination.  Pondering this question, I kept thinking of the riddle: what is black and white and red all over?

Colors: black, ivory, garnet

Approximately:  18” x 27”

100% cotton

These handwoven towels are absorbent, easy to care for, and develop a special beauty as you use them.

description:

name: red leaf towels 1
description:
As the seasons change, I've been noticing the leaves turning colors.  A red leaf, upon closer inspection, is actually comprised of several reds.

Colors: garnet, cerise, scarlet, gold, green, dark green

name: reflection 1
description:
I decided to revisit a palette from a few years ago. Looking at the sample I wove then, I saw that I've grown more confident and experimental with my color choices.

name: detour napkins
description:
Sometimes the final cloth bears no resemblance to the original color inspiration -- in this case the double yellow lines on the road.

Approximately:  18” x 18”

100% cotton

These handwoven napkins are absorbent, easy to care for, and develop a special beauty as you use them. 

Care instructions:  Wash them in your machine with warm or cold water and dry them on a medium heat to minimize shrinking and fading. Do not use fabric softener or dryer sheets as these can reduce the absorbency of the cloth.

name: latte on a sunny day napkins

Sipping a hot latte with foam under a blue sky on a warm February afternoon.  

Please note: The price is for a pair of napkins.

Approximately:  18” x 18”

These handwoven napkins are absorbent, easy to care for, and develop a special beauty as you use them.

name: by the quarry napkins
description:
I was running errands and thinking about color combinations when some purple wildflowers by the quarry caught my attention.  Then I started seeing purple flowers everywhere.

Please note:  The price is for the pair of napkins.  One is predominantly red violet with two dark green stripes at each end, the other is predominantly dark green with red violet stripes.  

Colors: grass green, kiwi, magenta, lilac, red violet, dark green

Approximately:  18” x 18”

100% cotton

These handwoven napkins are absorbent, easy to care for, and develop a special beauty as you use them. 

Care instructions:  Wash them in your machine with warm or cold water and dry them on a medium heat to minimize shrinking and fading. Do not use fabric softener or dryer sheets as these can reduce the absorbency of the cloth.

name: Serving Up Art napkins
description:
These napkins were designed to go with the rust lace table runners & mats I wove for the exhibit "Serving Up Art." The napkins have a wide kiwi stripe & narrow bermuda blue stripe.  One pair is a Dornick twill, the other a broken twill.

Please note:  The price is for a pair of napkins.

Colors: rust, kiwi, bermuda blue

Approximately:  18” x 18”

100% cotton

These handwoven napkins are absorbent, easy to care for, and develop a special beauty as you use them. 

Care instructions:  Wash them in your machine with warm or cold water and dry them on a medium heat to minimize shrinking and fading. Do not use fabric softener or dryer sheets as these can reduce the absorbency of the cloth.

name: reflection table runners
description:
I decided to revisit a palette from a few years ago. Looking at the sample I wove then, I saw that I've grown more confident and experimental with my color choices.

Colors: olive, kiwi, gold, rust, brown, periwinkle

Photos 1 & 2:  Grass, approximately 13.75" x 45.5"
Photo 3: Brick, approximately 13.75" x 49"
Photo 4: Olive, approximately 13.75" x 48.5"

100% cotton

These handwoven table runners are easy to care for and develop a special beauty as you use them. 

Care instructions:  Wash them in your machine with warm or cold water and dry them on a medium heat to minimize shrinking and fading. Do not use fabric softener or dryer sheets as these can reduce the absorbency of the cloth.

name: cloud table runners
description:
On overcast days I don't usually pay much attention to the sky except perhaps to search for signs that it might be clearing.  One day, I looked up and noticed that the gray above me was actually layers of clouds of different shades of gray moving at different speeds.

Colors: ivory, peach, light gray, flax, plum

Approximately 12" x 38"

100% cotton

These handwoven table runners are easy to care for and develop a special beauty as you use them. 

Care instructions:  Wash them in your machine with warm or cold water and dry them on a medium heat to minimize shrinking and fading. Do not use fabric softener or dryer sheets as these can reduce the absorbency of the cloth.

name: purple lace table runners
description:
I developed this style of table runner after a textile trip to Peru.  I was struck by the symbols woven into their cloth.  I chose lace because that's part of my western weaving tradition.

Colors: purple, daffodil, avocado, bark

Approximately:  18” x 49.5”

100% cotton

These handwoven table runners are easy to care for and develop a special beauty as you use them. 

Care instructions:  Wash them in your machine with warm or cold water and dry them on a medium heat to minimize shrinking and fading. Do not use fabric softener or dryer sheets as these can reduce the absorbency of the cloth.

name: peach lace table runners
description:
I developed this style of table runner after a textile trip to Peru.  I was struck by the symbols woven into their cloth.  I chose lace because that's part of my western weaving tradition.

Colors: peach, mead, garnet, pea green

Approximately:  13” x 57.5”

100% cotton

These handwoven table runners are easy to care for and develop a special beauty as you use them. 

Care instructions:  Wash them in your machine with warm or cold water and dry them on a medium heat to minimize shrinking and fading. Do not use fabric softener or dryer sheets as these can reduce the absorbency of the cloth.

name: rust lace table runner
description:
The asymmetrical stripes were inspired by an antique obi a customer showed me.  I've added a simple lace pattern to the wider stripes.

Colors:  rust, turquoise, pistachio

Crosses (photo 1): ca. 12.75" x 50"
Diamonds (photo 2): ca. 12.75" x 58" 

100% cotton

Care instructions:  Wash them in your machine with warm or cold water and dry them on a medium heat to minimize shrinking and fading. Do not use fabric softener or dryer sheets as these can reduce the absorbency of the cloth.  Iron on cotton setting with steam.

name: rust lace table mats
description:
The asymmetrical stripes were inspired by an antique obi a customer showed me.  I've added a simple lace pattern to the wider stripes.

Colors:  rust, turquoise, pistachio

Approximately 12.5" x 18.5"

Please note: the price is for a pair of two mats 

100% cotton

Care instructions:  Wash them in your machine with warm or cold water and dry them on a medium heat to minimize shrinking and fading. Do not use fabric softener or dryer sheets as these can reduce the absorbency of the cloth.  Iron on cotton setting with steam.

Diamonds (photo 1): ca. 12.75" x 48"

Care instructions:  Wash them in your machine with warm or cold water and dry them on a medium heat to minimize shrinking and fading. Do not use fabric softener or dryer sheets as these can reduce the absorbency of the cloth.  Iron on cotton setting with steam.

name: dark turquoise lace table runner
description:
The asymmetrical stripes were inspired by an antique obi a customer showed me.  I've added a simple lace pattern to the wider stripes.

Colors:  dark turquoise, garnet, white

Squares (photo 1): ca. 12.75" x 36"
Crosses (photo 2): ca. 12,75" x 60"

100% cotton

Care instructions:  Wash them in your machine with warm or cold water and dry them on a medium heat to minimize shrinking and fading. Do not use fabric softener or dryer sheets as these can reduce the absorbency of the cloth.  Iron on cotton setting with steam.

name: Holly scarf
description:
When my friend Holly asked me to weave her a scarf, I had her pick the colors she wanted.  I couldn't just weave one scarf so here are the others.

Colors: medium gray, light gray, grass green, kiwi, light orange, orange 

Dark purple (photo 1):  approximately 9.5” x 72” without fringe
Olive (photo 2):  approximately 9.5” x 62” without fringe

100% cotton

Care instructions:  Wash scarf in a lingerie bag to protect the fringe.  Wash it in your machine with warm or cold water and dry them on a medium heat to minimize shrinking and fading. Do not use fabric softener or dryer sheets as these can reduce the absorbency of the cloth.  Iron on the cotton setting.

name: Lori Ann scarf
description:
Lori Ann scanned her color fan and sent me a copy.  It was such fun to work with all her muted colors that I had to weave a few scarves.

Colors: salmon, terra cotta, dusty teal, dusty blue, sierra, khaki

Plum (photo 1):  approximately 9.5” x 70” without fringe
Denim (photo 2):  approximately 9.5” x 70” without fringe
sierra (photo 3):  approximately 9.5" x 62" without fringe

100% cotton

Care instructions:  Wash scarf in a lingerie bag to protect the fringe.  Wash it in your machine with warm or cold water and dry them on a medium heat to minimize shrinking and fading. Do not use fabric softener or dryer sheets as these can reduce the absorbency of the cloth.  Iron on the cotton setting.
